timeline.message:
[sunspec] Support for inverter dc side readout

This commit increases the amount if data read out from inverters by
adding support for the DC side values (current, voltage, power)

Signed-off-by: Nagy Attila Gabor <mrbig@sneaker.hu>

[sunspec] support for default AC phase data

This commit adds support for the default AC phase information readout

This must be supported by all types of invertes.

Signed-off-by: Nagy Attila Gabor <mrbig@sneaker.hu>

[sunspec] Support for two and three phase inverters

Two and tree phase inverter description differs from single phase inverters
only by having multiple ac phase descriptor groups. All these fields are optional
because they share the same descriptor block with the single phase inverter
type.

Signed-off-by: Nagy Attila Gabor <mrbig@sneaker.hu>

timeline.bodyText: Any reason scaleFactor couldn't be primitive?
timeline.author: cpmeister
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -507,6 +507,20 @@ protected State getScaled(Optional<? extends Number> value, Optional<Short> scal
         return getScaled(value.get().longValue(), scaleFactor.get(), unit);
     }
 
+    /**
+     * Returns value multiplied by the 10 on the power of scaleFactory
+     *
+     * @param value the value to alter
+     * @param scaleFactor the scale factor to use (may be negative)
+     * @return the scaled value as a DecimalType
+     */
+    protected State getScaled(Optional<? extends Number> value, Short scaleFactor, Unit<?> unit) {

replies.bodyText:
In some cases the scaleFactor is also optional per spec. I didn't want to mix primitives and Optional<...>-s.
Also note, that optional values have to be treated differently if omitted: in case of a missing optional value we output the UnDefType. Any other case will output a reasonable default value.
replies.author: mrbig

timeline.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText: Thanks I was aware of that, but that would lead to a different implementation of the getScaled, wich is incorrect in the case of mandatory fields. Mandatory fields will never output an UnDefType value.
replies.author: mrbig

replies.bodyText:
Mandatory fields will never output an UnDefType value.

I don't understand, your code clearly returns and UnDefType if it is missing a value...
replies.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText:
ignore my previous commit, I did misunderstand you. Now I see what you meant: there is a code duplication even if it's an if, and you are absolutely right.
I removed the duplication. By the way I removed the unitless getScaled methods, I do not intend to use them anymore.
replies.author: mrbig

timeline.bodyText: These should be using your channelUID(...) method in instead.
timeline.author: cpmeister
cpmeister

replies.bodyText: I have the 4th PR ready wich will add support for smart meters. But they use a different handler class, so this if will have an else if ... block with other thing types. That's the reason why this isn't a simple map lookup at the moment..
replies.author: mrbig

timeline.bodyText: Does this need to be a map? I don't see you using the map keys, is that for a future PR?
timeline.author: cpmeister

replies.author: mrbig

timeline.message:
[sunspec] using channelUID method

Signed-off-by: Nagy Attila Gabor <mrbig@sneaker.hu>

timeline.bodyText: Is that the naming used by the protocol specification? Otherwise I would prefer L1, L2, L3, which is the common naming.
timeline.author: J-N-K

replies.bodyText:
This specification use Phase A/B/C. For example here is one doc available: https://www.solaredge.com/sites/default/files/sunspec-implementation-technical-note.pdf see page 17.
But I understand your point as well. Maybe we could just change the labels?
replies.author: mrbig

replies.bodyText:
If A B C is the notation used by the standard this is probably how the devices are labeled, too. So we should keep that.
As you pointed out, we could use something like A (L1) for the labels.
replies.author: J-N-K

replies.bodyText: Thanks, rephased the group labels. Also found a typo I was overlooking so far.
replies.author: mrbig
